Message.Msg: "ORCL blamed their software sales force for their big miss this quarter. The truth is that IBM is kicking their rear ends and taking market share. IBM will be down tomorrow in sympathy with the ORCL debacle. That will provide wise traders an opportunity to buy before IBM reports next month..." I hope so -- ORCL missed a Q a couple of years ago -- probably 2010 -- and they said the same thing and I remember reading their explanation about expanding the sales force. The problem is that IBM hardware has been weak but getting stronger in Q4. I do believe that ORCL has a much higher % of revenue from the US Gov't than IBM -- I believe it's around 1% for IBM and around 10% for ORCL -- at least that's what I recall reading. Anyone know?
